_Atz2lHV745tc8xHRNZgsA.text: Great breakfast spot. Very good food, excellent coffee and service. The portions are huge and I love the greens that accompany breakfast.

WlfCulXMlHPV59T-KcA3DQ.text: So good!  One of my favorite breakfast spots.  The toast, for 50 cents, is to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Bacon crepe.   It doesn&#39;t come with eggs on top as the menu states....

8ppGdW1HWGIDhIdCDf80Rw.text: Highly recommend this small but comfortable place. Sweet people, warm music, fine food. PS: The bacon crepe was huge.

CtrJ101NwlaDfCr-EGUfsw.text: This is a bright spot where chains rule.  Great breakfast and  coffee.  French Turkish food.

ujzm0q2d8cZpLTVY5Czvbw.text: it was my first time here, I really enjoyed the food and amazing service!! Pancakes are bomb, coffee is so good, Authentic and very European place, definitely coming back!

ofaowp0agLmkPt4MiDWV0g.text: Crepes and panini were very good. Atmosphere was charming and very European. And, good service to round it out. Highly recommended.

EPXJUh7JwC8ygT0tsfhM0g.text: no need an explanation!! look at the picture!! prices are really average when you compre the plates! plates are giant!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States

XfeZnHxlNSC0viTReKoUwQ.text: This was another great find courtesy of Yelp. We figured we would end up at Denny's or Dunkin Donuts because they were both close to our hotel. Thanks to Yelp we found this little gem in a small strip mall behind Dunkin and Denny's and still in walking distance to our hotel. We were there for breakfast shortly before 9 on a Sunday morning.  I had the French toast with strawberries and it was really tasty. My husband had a western omelet and really enjoyed it. The staff was friendly and welcoming and we had very little wait time for anything. Bypass the chain places and go just a short step off the main road to get a delicious start to your day.

Mrg5cKbpGBOnfxy4rAdOCw.text: This is absolutely  one of my best restaurants in Pittsburgh I loved the decoration the food every thing was fabulous. They might need more waiters and more working hours. Food is so delicious and yummy I can't wait to visit them again.

HSOufnh6ZCTMK9fMVKhKyQ.text: Great breakfast place!  Crepes were absolutely delicious, coffee was great, service was awesome.  Can't complain about anything.

GdROocL7W6h0gSneDOCrnQ.text: Great service, awesome coffee, fresh ingredients....cozy

ra48TqxOC7Wn7y3e7Sc5eQ.text: The chicken omelette was amazing.  My son had the Nutella lava crepe cake.  Need I say more?  You need to have breakfast here.  Best I have had anywhere in years.

JNx6f3FvP66IVQwJ282O5A.text: So happy to have this new little breakfast and lunch place in our area. The breakfast food was delicious and the portions are fit for a king.  I can't wait to come back and try the lunch menu.

gUEjCQ1q-m2mM5oUYpNXYA.text: I don't know what took me so long to review this place - it is fantastic! I come here occasionally to meet with my financial advisor and I am thinking of reinvesting money just so I have an excuse for him to take me here again!  The omelettes are wonderful and the salads are great, though the dressings are not homemade, which is too bad.  I've never had a bad meal here though and the service is amazing.  Very courteous and friendly.  I'll be back - even if it means changing my 401K contribution!

KfTVvcAphitw2r7ShbNB9A.text: Was hoping this was going to be a new favorite breakfast spot. Couldn't have been more disappointed. I ordered banana pancakes and a side of sausage. The sausage was definitely microwave sausage. The "banana" pancakes were nothing more than the over cooked flavorless pancakes with a sliced banana on top.  My wife had the bacon and corn pancakes. The menu leads you to believe this dish is going to be some sort of griddle cake with corn in the batter. Nope. Just some canned corn dumped on top of three pancakes with microwave bacon and cheese in them. Was one of the most bizarre food presentations I've seen. Sadly, this restaurant makes the chain restaurants nearby look like Michelin star rated restaurants.

WInvejp38zee5NjUN_Bjfg.text: Found my new breakfast spot.  It's so hard to find good breakfast food.  This place has fresh everything, fast, and a great staff.  Go there, now!!!

vxQF5yf9ITl9pymX32Swrw.text: Great spot to grab brunch. Certainly the only restaurant of its kind on that strip of Rt. 28. Food is good and the remodel makes it feel a bit more sophisticated than the location may suggest.

u4_cehO58kQmAS5WqPR39A.text: A while back I realized that I need to be a little more judicious with awarding 5 stars, because good does not equate great and great does not equate awesome!  Well, I found this place (thanks to yelpers) and it is a SOLID 5 Star affair!  I had the chicken omelet...oh my goodness!  It was amazing!!!  No seriously, AMAZING!  It came with 4 small pancakes that would shame the cities most popular spots (light crispy outside texture across the whole pancake and super fluffy inside!  Yep, perfection!!!  I can't wait to go back and try ALL of their other dishes!  Finally, I'm a True coffee snob and their coffee was again excellent!  This place is a must do, it's worth the drive and it is awesome!  Thanks yelpers for mentioning this place and aiding my discovery of this new gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States

1hz6T7GDadiSbIu-DbRd7Q.text: Since we have discovered this hidden gem located in Harmarville we have returned 3 times to savor the delicious cuisine!  I believe that word is spreading about how special this "petit " cafe is.  Ask for orange juice and receive freshly squeezed topped with a strawberry. In fact everything is fresh and made to order.  Today we had the vegetable omelet which was served with pancakes. You could get toast instead but those pancakes are melt in your mouth delicious. Also had the banana pancakes with a side of ham. The crepes are wonderful too, served with a salad. The proprietors are French with Turkish heritage. So welcoming and accomadating!  The decor is lovely with a French theme throughout.  The coffee is strong reflecting a European brew .  Lots of coffee drinks available too.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Crepe served with a salad
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Eggs in a cloud
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Banana pancakes

QSFseSbwZa4c25dalsxjoQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while and finally made it today.  It was excellent!   I got the western omelet and it's the best I've ever had at a restaurant.  I also got some pancakes with it.  They were very good.  My daughter got the French toast and a side of bacon.  Bacon was perfectly crisped.  French toast was fantastic.  No complaints.  Good service as well.  Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States

6UQpWzA_kGrn9hfbmwXYMw.text: Obviously spinach feta crepe is my favorite,very different and cozy place,I love the most coffee and warm design,daisy(papatya) flowers on the wall.The staff are very nice and friendly.Definitely I'll come back.

ZVQq-D3GHNjDq7CDHxCG8g.text: I don't know what took me so long to come here and it's in my neck of the woods! Fresh wonderful food.... got so busy after I got here! I highly recommend it... had the spinach feta cheese crepes with a salad and bacon and delicious Turkish coffee!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States

cY6g2rpwzY1eSUa5yKcf2A.text: My mom and I decided to grab a bite and picked here since I've never been. The ambiance alone makes this place somewhere I'll totally come back. My mom had the ground beef panini with French fries, and I had the chicken crepe and they both were phenomenal. 10/10 recommend and will definitely be coming back!

j0_0PQmDPA1jUoL5tFnDdA.text: Based off of other reviews, I really thought that I would love this place... unfortunately, that was not the case. I ordered the egg and cheese panini, which was not a panini at all. It was scrambled eggs and cheese on white bread. Definitely never touched a panini press. Very similar to something I make at home. Not worth $11!  I had the sandwich with a side of fries, which I was hoping to be fresh cut - but they were frozen. Blah.  Plus, service was very slow. I waited for a menu... waited to water, which ended up being a mini bottle of water from Walmart... waited for food... never got checked on... and had to ask for my check. I won't be back.

0pk-_go0ndASBABEuMentg.text: Sat down at a table, was never greeted. A miniature bottle of water was brought over to us with the menus. It look at least 15 minutes for them to come over and get our drink order, which we just ordered our food. We got the exact same breakfast sandwich and they still screwed it up. They brought our coffee with our meals, not beforehand. The breakfast sandwich has two side options...french fries or string lettuce which they called a salad. I was dying for another water but nobody came over until we were done with our meal. Never asked how we wanted our check. It's a small place. It shouldnt be hard to check on your table to see if everything is okay. I've been a waitress, so I understand a lot. But this place was a huge disappointment.

QRypPKoLQpQDEMxEdzNokw.text: Great. Fresh fruit very welcoming enjoyed breakfast here multiple times tea and coffee served with hot milk

A0ue76-d6RpHImJzVxXcfg.text: My main issue is the massive use of plastic. Little plastic bottles for every customer. Please get a water filter and use glass. Thank you!

-Gx3gErS8BD439kMxY_cMg.text: Horrific. Mediocre. Bland. We went here because we had a gift card, and our family was shocked at the laziness of the workers and the low quality of the food. The workers constantly played on their phones instead of doing their job! Petit dejeuner does not care about anything. They do not care about their customers: The workers play on their phones. I had a giftcard and went here, not realizing that Snapchat would be a higher priority than me.They do not care about the environment:  One inch tall water bottles instead of cups. That's ridiculous and so wasteful! This is the reason why sea animals are choking on plastic, Petite Dejeuner!  The workers got the order wrong numerous times and when we asked to have our coffee in a to-go cup, the lady snarled and stomped into the kitchen. WHILE she played a game on her phone. If you even talk to the waitress, she acts like you're in convincing her. The sandwiches were mediocre and everything was SO overpriced. No one was washing dishes which explains why everything was on styrofoam plates! Apparently, they don't feel like washing anything! Not even a cup or a plate! This was a horrible experience and I constantly felt like the worker could flip out on me if I asked for a new teeny water bottle. Please do not go here, so they up their game.

H4z1oYV_HTxM-eQ6KEd8lw.text: Tasty crepes and friendly staff!  Restaurant is modern and relaxing atmosphere.   And they have a great espresso machine.

ZEzGbW1zTC9jnOIcWogwIg.text: I don't normally have the time to leave reviews here on Yelp... I travel all over the US for work and have to live on restaurant food while on the road... after all the little places I've experienced... then this wonderful place ... I have to say...   I may NEVER be happy eating breakfast again... this place was so incredibly delicious !! It has set my bar of expectations for every other breakfast place I will go next so high I fear I will not get a satisfactory breakfast again! The omelet I ordered was massive... the egg was cooked perfect ... not burned or over cooked anywhere:.. the bread... oh the bread! Soft ... lightly toasted.. warm... best toast I've ever had ... no doubt it was home made bread... because no store made bread would taste this good... thick slices... and they served my omelet with a salad which was a perfect accent to the breakfast...   It is sad that I cannot finish the omelet... it was huge and every bite better than the last... I am in this area for one more day and you better believe I will be here tomorrow and, if I ever get the chance to return to the area, I will be here each and every day for breakfast!!  Yelp: one suggestion - allow me to leave 10 stars instead of 5 cause this place deserves every star I can give it and more that I cannot!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States

ksfN4vJqP-rKUlVxUNMnJg.text: Had crepes and an omelet, it was all delicious! Cute little restaurant with a nice atmosphere.

28acEYGxmcQIc78HP9gq-A.text: My.family had breakfast there and it was delicious! Spinach feta omelette was great with some Turkish coffee. Kids had chocolate croissants that they raved about. Lots of food

TcmqnfaTRqrZeY_qA5F5bQ.text: Amazing. This was our first visit and we are impressed. Can't quite figure out why they chose to locate in Harmarville, in a strip mall, but so glad we found it. Food was perfect, coffee worth waiting for, presentation was beautiful and obvious care taken to enhance every aspect of our experience. Can't wait to go back.

gvho5STruK-6SXGjDxcaQg.text: We love this place and found it great for bringing the whole family (including young ones) to breakfast. They open early and have easy sides of fruit, etc that come out fast and in the right portions for kids. Love their steak and filet omelette and the fact you can get small pancakes as your side makes everyone happy (especially if you are sharing).  Definitely worth the trip and easy/free parking never hurts.

3Xg6wOU8FaluQ8e6duGnzg.text: So my first impressions on this place were very wrong. In the Gino Brothers name sake I thought of great anyway they can make more money which isn't a bad thing but I've had equally mixed experiences with Gino Bros. First time we were here it was a very busy Saturday morning. We got in and got table immediately but by 20 minutes later it was standing room only. I thought it was crazy cause the prices aren't cheap. Then our food arrived. Looked really good. By far the best omelette I've had in a really long time. Eggs light and yet cooked to perfection. Packed with cheese. Delicious!!! The four little pancakes that say are 2 as a side choice are fantastic. Pancakes cooked that are thicker yet not doughy or lumpy. Just perfect. Really fantastic offering. My wife got the ham and mozzarella crepe with side fresh greens and said it was fantastic and to die for. She really liked it. Everything is so fresh and cooked impeccably well. They have a unique community table in the middle of the restaurant with 4 long benches which I find different yet inviting to bring people together. The decor is really nice and very clean yet trendy. The bathrooms are the nicest cleanest bathrooms I've seen in I think ever. The coffee/espresso machine is pretty cool looking too! Lol. I highly recommend coming here. It's kind of a hidden gem in my honest opinion. Fantastic! Also and how could I forget the service is friendly and welcoming and very attentive! Bravo!

ULCJrrSgRjanizDl2Gh-gQ.text: Awesome food! I had the croissant egg sandwich and I added ham. It was melt in your mouth and amazing. This photo is only have if it Bc I forgot to take a photo. Great service. Clean, fresh, great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Half of the chocolate strawberry crepe. Perfect.
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Fruit bowl. So fresh and delicious.
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Half the croissant. AMAZING

yB2PhQozz-RMS9dS81XTBg.text: We went there with my friend. Everybody was so friendly, also the food was amazing. I ate fruit tea waffle, the waffle was soft and tasty. My friend eat omelet and pancakes which were amazing also. Coffee is more than good. You should go there and enjoy a friendly atmosphere and fabulous food.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Fruittea waffle
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Waffle with fruit

vURsfNiJuMo3luF4K_ccyw.text: Had the spinach and feta cheese crepe, my first savory crepe ever--it was amazing!  Packed full of ingredients, literally melted in my mouth!  Wish I could have eaten the whole thing there, but it was too big--took it home and finished it that day for lunch!  My SIL had a nutella, banana, strawberry, walnut crepe which looked amazing, as well.  She told me it was delish.  Will be back to this hidden gem!

RzLF1ar5zDp0slcxzfmGwQ.text: Tried Gino's for breakfast on Sunday!  Awesome crepes. Can't wait til I can bring my wife for the vegetarian breakfast!

lAPnhDLf01vb4AIgB2h6hA.text: What a find in the last place to expect it! We stopped here before getting on the turnpike on a Friday morning so there was no crowd. The menu is quite unique. I had the corn and bacon cakes with a potato brown. My husband had the steak omelette which was huge! The coffee was so good and they steam the milk!!!  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Corn &amp; bacon cakes
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Potato Brown...like a mashed potatocake with corn and spicy sausage (I think) SO GOOD!
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Steak omelette

y1Hj_oRGHkva93h1CAymbw.text: Decent food, but lacks finesse. The scrambled eggs are actually chopped to death and look minced. No body whatsoever, just flat. The croissant was not was microwaved and tasted mushy. I'd stick to the crepes and waffles, those were good.

v6cT_jRBBXRM8DilHu6wRA.text: I can't say enough good about this French gem that's tucked away off of Freeport Road in Harmar Twp.  Everything from the atmosphere, to the humble, friendly service and food quality is top notch.  When you're here, you feel like you're in Europe.  My wife and I look forward to going back soon.

qtqBgCpIJAI-lK40Dgu9PA.text: So glad I stumbled across his place! The food, service, and atmosphere were all great! They have a variety of coffee drinks to order and a decent breakfast menu. I had the strawberry crepes and they were really good! The food was served quickly after ordering. Can't wait to go back for breakfast again!

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States

Izk_SdJFNrg7V6EExpgHPw.text: This is outside of the city but it's a really nice space and the food is delicious. Their waffles are fluffy and hearty. I think they're made of whole wheat since they're darker looking but very tasty. They also put vanilla ice cream on them which is a nice top

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Waffogateaux

9G_fg9wkASurrMRgIR64Kw.text: Great change of pace for breakfast! Awesome omelettes, pancakes, crepes and unique menu items! And also - super coffee!

z9Nf_IUBuyLywFUCH1NfSw.text: We stayed at a nearby hotel for a wedding. Lots of gross chain restaurants in sight but thankfully Yelp took us here on our first morning and the second morning we came back here without even a discussion. Coffee press with an Omlette or Crepe and you are set. Friendly staff. It is excellent food so you may have to wIt a few minutes but its worth it...An Oasis in a Stripmall~

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Omlette
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Cheese crepe
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States. Omlette

sqXoC54CY5UQg_bgK5F7Hw.text: Petit Dejeuner was everything my husband and I wanted and more. It's beautifully decorated and the waitstaff are friendly and professional. You can sense that the people working there love what they do and are eager to make delicious food. Which was by far the best part of the experience. I ordered a bacon crepe that did not disappoint and my husband enjoyed an omelette with pancakes. Finally we ordered the Nutella French toast which was addictively good. We can't wait to return and try more of their menu! Excellent little place in Harmar!

s-nf_Br8pjQjuSqi4rm-JA.text: The best breakfast I've ever had. I didn't know I liked omelettes til I came here. Even came with a delicious side of 3 petite pancakes. Everything cooked to perfection. Wonderful atmosphere as well

6gq4cnpRY3bJ0ytNftGwrQ.text: Quaint. Delicious food. Couldn't decide what to order because I wanted three or four different entrees. Highly recommend.

g8e7IiWAFgtKfqvMevQ-rQ.text: Our favorite breakfast place in the area. Hidden gem for sure. The crepes are delicious. The pancakes are yummy. Omelettes are generous and good ratio of add-OMS to eggs. Coffee is really good too. It's become our staple.

yRYIConFxjLwXlVlakgpqw.text: Best breakfast around. Coffee like you are in France. Food always excellent. Staff always friendly.

Gvj7PNlMo1yUELHf9rE-WQ.text: Really good breakfast.  Not what one normally expects, but not too different and tastes great.  Portions are large, very filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States
Photo of Ginos  Petit Dejeuner Breakfast - Harmarville, PA, United States

ZnMCesABjAn1WIXQxrqIMg.text: Just discovered this place on Yelp today. Pulled up at 1:55 and the doors were locked. Sign read "Come back tomorrow at 7:00". Hours are posted on website until 3:00. Walked next door to second of three separate Gino's entities, and the waitress said "We have nothing to do with them". "Just the same name, some store front, and same horrible service" was my reply as I huffed out the door and off to Bob Evans a mile away.
